core.useritem

Class UserItemManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.useritem.UserItemManager

  • public class UserItemManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that manage Items that are in Users' itemAvailables and wishLists and related requests (item requests).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserItemManager(java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,Item>> itemRequests, int newestItemId)
      Creates an UserItemManager with itemRequests, all requests from users, and newestItemId, an unique identifier to be assigned to when creating Item object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserItemManager

        public UserItemManager(java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,Item>> itemRequests,
                       int newestItemId)
        Creates an UserItemManager with itemRequests, all requests from users, and newestItemId, an unique identifier to be assigned to when creating Item object.
        Parameters:
        itemRequests - a list of pairs, with the value1 being the username of the user who wants to request the item, and value2 being the data of the item to be added.
        newestItemId - the identifier the the next Item to be created.

    • Method Detail

      • getItemDescriptionToIDMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getItemDescriptionToIDMap()
        Get a map where the key is a long description of this item used when browsing inventory, and where the value is the id of the said item.
        Returns:
        a map where the key is a long description of this item used when browsing inventory, and where the value is the id of the said item.

      • getWishlistItemDescriptionToIDMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getWishlistItemDescriptionToIDMap()
        Get a map where the key is a long description of this item used when browsing wishlist, and where the value is the id of the said item.
        Returns:
        a map where the key is a long description of this item used when browsing wishlist, and where the value is the id of the said item.

      • getUsernameFromItem

        public java.lang.String getUsernameFromItem(Item item,
                                            UserAccountManager ua)
        Returns the username of the account that has the given item in the available items Returns null if there is no such account found in all users
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be searched
        ua - a UserAccountManager for accessing user information
        Returns:
        The username of the account that contains the item, or null if not found

      • updateUserItems

        public void updateUserItems(User user1,
                            User user2,
                            Item oneToTwo,
                            Item twoToOne)
        Updates the data of the two user that has completed a transaction of items. This transaction can be either trading or returning Items.
        Parameters:
        user1 - The initiator User of the Trade
        user2 - The responder of the other User of the Trade
        oneToTwo - Possible Item that username1 lend to username2
        twoToOne - Possible Item that username2 lend to username1

      • getNewestItemId

        public int getNewestItemId()
        Return the newest item id
        Returns:
        the newest item id

      • getFormattedItemRequests

        public java.util.Map<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>,Pair<java.lang.String,Item>> getFormattedItemRequests()
        Gets formatted representation of itemRequests
        Returns:
        A Map from:  Pairs of (short description, long description) of this requests
        to:  Pairs that represent the requests in DataBundle

      • getUserItemsAvailable

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getUserItemsAvailable(User user)
        Get one user's itemAvailable
        Parameters:
        user - the target user
        Returns:
        a collection of String description of all items in user's itemAvailable

      • acceptUserItemRequest

        public void acceptUserItemRequest(Pair<java.lang.String,Item> request,
                                  UserAccountManager ua)
        Add the given Item to the given user's ItemAvailable list, remove this request from itemRequests
        Parameters:
        request - the request (what is stored in DataBundle)
        ua - a UserAccountManager for accessing user information

      • denyUserItemRequest

        public void denyUserItemRequest(Pair<java.lang.String,Item> request)
        Keep the given user's ItemAvailable list no change, remove this request from itemRequests
        Parameters:
        request - the request (what is stored in DataBundle)

      • deleteFromWishlist

        public ActionReverter deleteFromWishlist(User user,
                                         Item item)
        Delete an item to a user's wishlist. An item can be deleted if the user exist in the system and item is in the user's wishlist.
        Parameters:
        user - This user
        item - The item to be deleted
        Returns:
        ActionReverter for undoing this action, null if the action failed.

      • addToWishlist

        public ActionReverter addToWishlist(User user,
                                    Item item)
        Add an item to a user's wishlist. An item can be added if the user exist in the system and item is not in the user's wishlist.
        Parameters:
        user - This user
        item - The item to be added
        Returns:
        ActionReverter for undoing this action, null if the action failed.

      • createItemAndRequest

        public ActionReverter createItemAndRequest(java.lang.String username,
                                           java.lang.String itemType,
                                           java.lang.String itemName,
                                           java.lang.String itemDescription)
        Requests to add an item to this user's itemAvailable.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user who requests.
        itemType - the type of the item that is requested.
        itemName - the name of the item that is requested.
        itemDescription - the description of the item that is requested.
        Returns:
        ActionReverter for undoing this action, null if the action failed.

      • getInventory

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getInventory(java.util.List<User> users)
        Get information of all items in a list of users' items available for lend, in userList.
        Parameters:
        users - a list of users.
        Returns:
        a list of string representations of items in the inventory

      • getUserWishlist

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getUserWishlist(User user)
        Get a list of this user's items in wishlist
        Parameters:
        user - this user
        Returns:
        a list of this user's items in wishlist

      • createLendingSuggestion

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> createLendingSuggestion(User lender,
                                                                User borrower)
        Suggest a list of items from lender to lend to borrower. Only items that are both in lender's itemAvailable and borrower's wishList are included.
        Parameters:
        lender - the lender that needs suggestion about items to lend to a borrower.
        borrower - the borrower that the lender is interested in lending to.
        Returns:
        a list of item that are both in lender's available list and borrower's wish list.

      • createBorrowingSuggestion

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> createBorrowingSuggestion(User user,
                                                                  java.util.List<User> users,
                                                                  java.util.List<java.lang.String> itemTypes)
        Suggest a list of items user might like depends on the user's most frequent borrow types.
        Parameters:
        user - the user looking for items to trade.
        users - a list of users the user can trade with
        itemTypes - a collection of String representation of itemTypes
        Returns:
        a list, with the first thing a string of the user's most frequent borrow types, the rest of thing the items the user may like as Strings.

      • getItemFromId

        public Item getItemFromId(int itemId,
                          java.util.List<User> users)
        Get Item correspond to itemId in itemsAvailable of any User in users.
        Parameters:
        itemId - the id of the Item.
        users - the list of Users that may has this Item.
        Returns:
        the Item object if such Item exist, null otherwise.

      • getItemFromId

        public Item getItemFromId(int itemId,
                          User user)
        Get Item correspond to itemId in a User's itemsAvailable
        Parameters:
        itemId - the id of the Item.
        user - the user that may has this Item.
        Returns:
        the Item object if such Item exist, null otherwise.

      • itemCanNotLend

        public boolean itemCanNotLend(User user,
                              int itemId)
        Check if the Item with itemId can be lent by user. Item can be lent if it is in this user's itemsAvailable.
        Parameters:
        itemId - the id of the Item.
        user - the user who wants to lend the Item correspond to itemId.
        Returns:
        true if item in users' itemsAvailable, false otherwise.

      • itemCanBorrow

        public boolean itemCanBorrow(java.util.List<User> users,
                             int itemId)
        Check if the Item with itemId can be borrowed. Item can be borrowed if it is itemsAvailable of and User in users.
        Parameters:
        users - the list of users this user can borrow from.
        itemId - the id of this item.
        Returns:
        true if item in users' itemsAvailable, false otherwise.
